alert.note: Alert for Idaho Palouse (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 06 at 2:33PM MST until January 07 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to two inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 8 and 12 inches possible, with localized higher amounts. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Plummer, Moscow, Genesee, and Potlatch. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 AM PST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Monday morning through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...The strong winds and weight of snow on tree limbs may down power lines and could cause sporadic power outages. Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening commutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Idaho, for the latest road information in Idaho, call 5 1 1. In Washington, for the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel
